reviewText: In this film Everhart is the only one that even comes close to being a grade "A" actor! Penny, Russo and unfortunately Eric Roberts who has done nothing noteworthy since "The Pope Of Greenwich Village" fame are all barely believable in their rolls! It's watchable and ends with a chuckle so it's not all bad!
Quite frankly was expecting more from a film starring Angie Everhart, Eric Roberts, and James Russo.  Not worth the waste of time.

Beginning of movie Angie is sweet mannered then becomes bitter. This movie has Action / Thrills / Erotica / Suspense & will watch yet again. Starring Angie Everhart,James Russo,Brian Wimmer,Joe Penny,Francia Di Mase,Eric Roberts.
If you like the tough gal, get even type you will love this movie. Angela Everhart is excellent as is Eric Roberts.

I have no idea what the positive reviews saw but it could not have been this movie.  The script was stupid and the acting puerile.  I have seen better in a high school production.  I am glad I borrowed this movie instead of buying it.

Are the pictures at the beginning of the Movie (the kid pics) actually Angie Everhart?! I totally think so. The one's of her as a teenager obviously look like her, so logically those are really her high school photos. Just thought that this was cool, especially since I've wanted to know what she looked like as a kid.

I confirm other positive reviews about this work...
The best moments are clearly those where Ms. Everhart is engaged in action shoots (I think that Angie should exploit more this kind of role than those ones played in psycho-thrillers like the most recent The Last Cry... le physique est avec elle... in every sense) yet I'd have liked the captivity part to be a little developed... 5/10 min would have been enough and not have compromised the budget (IMO).
ps: actually I must admit that the first reason for me to rent this movie has been the presence of Angie "Redhot" Everhart but I've not been disappointed... bear in mind that this is the first movie of her I've seen where she has been wearing her dresses... full time... and that's is a compliment by me.
An excellent movie, Angie Everhart was a Refreshing departure from the normal helpless female, a sharp intelligent lady with a lot of positive mental attitude, More of the same Please!!
Good thing Angie and Eric were in this movie....
Got to me...but I don't pay a lot of attention to the realism probablities of events...think of this as literature...Good film.  Highly recommended.
B movie at best.....find another way to be entertained.
Pretty good.
Very enjoyable and kept me on the edge of the seat.
ok,  a bit slow at times.
don't expect too much
Good movie
was able to watch it only because of Angie Everhart but bad movie
I'm a big Eric Roberts fan so I always enjoy his work. Plot was simple but good. But it wasn't a riveting movie and had some holes in it.
Quite simply, the actions of the characters make no sense whatsoever.  The most nonsensical movie I have watched in a long time.

Eric Roberts is one of those actors who can portray malevolent evil believably. He does a good job in this one. The use of vulgar language lost its ability to indicate strong emotions decades ago, as it became more important for movie makers to push the envelope than make cogent movies. This was an otherwise watchable revenge flick.

I just didn't like this movie. A nice girl goes to prison and comes out of it like she's a killer. I understand prison can change a person big time, but, to this extent, I don't think so. I guess I'm being a little too rigid, but I don't think they gave her shooting practice while in the pen. hah
good suspense show.  Did not like ending as you never know what happens to the hand cuffed guy....do police get him and find out what happened...seem to be left with no closure.
Good movie
Love it

This movie will take all of your patience to sit through it. One might sit through it (as I did) thinking it will surely get better. No such luck.
It is laughably inane. Put this one on your list to SKIP, even if it is for free.
Really old and bad -- not worth watching!
a good movie with a twist !
Too much swearing.
An interesting, older movie.
Held my interest....really hated the boyfriend.  Guess the actor did a good job.
ok
Great movie lots of action

I was going to give it a 4, but the ending put it over the top. Started out with her angry and nothing else and each time he saved her or brought her away from one of her shooting sprees, she appreciated him more. They wore each other out from their own " woe is me" life to start life anew. Humorous ending " I make a mean omelot" and his " Okay, But I'll make the coffee." You have to see the movie to understand what that means. It was like a romantic crime spoof.
it is not the worst movie out there but it is not great I found it enjoyable and does got strong action worth buying I would say yes
Good
Low budget feel
Awful. Terrible. Why would Eric Roberts even been in it? Awful job in the editing room?
This story of a woman's revenge against her ex-lover was not great.  Okay if you have time to waste otherwise not really recommending it,.
Very disappointing
Good movie.

Not Bad. Love seein' Eric Roberts getting clipped, made me laugh.  A knock off of the old revenge against the mob movies. Nice simple plot, FUN! Kept me laughing while I did my books. HAHAHAHAHA
Thank you Angie Everhart. YUM!!!!
LOUSY

I wouldn't bother writing this if not for Angie Everhart's lead in the movie.  SHE was entertaining in her determined-woman-who-will-stop-at-nothing character hell-bent on revenge for her undeserved prison stint.  The story and the other actors were all so-so.  Angie kept me from bailing.
Far better than I anticipated.  Nice acting and characters; Eric Roberts hair styles alone are worth watching.  Some nice action and killings.
Not sure why I spent time watching this.  Too much violence and not enough story.

Stupid movie - heroine has never heard of rubber gloves or identification by finger prints and she can kill everyone except the one she's been gunning for all along...  The cop's line about if she wanted to "rot in jail" for killing her ex-, like she's not going to "rot in jail" for the ten people she killed before she got to him.  I have never written a review before but this movie was so BAD I felt morally obligated to warn the unknowing public away from watching it.
The acting wasn't the best; however, it wasn't a bad plot.
Very poor movie expected morefromEric Roberts..would not recommended to anyone. Certainly not a favorite of mine. Poorly written, even worsened when inacted.
Angie makes the movie.
I like the movie
It was obviously low budget.  The male lead could act...the female not so much....the script needed a lot of work...not really worth the time.
I thought it was suspenseful and very under rated.
Promedio

Did not feel authentic. More like one of my father's "shoot 'em ups" when I was a child. A bunch of random actions with no meaning thrown together by the screenwriter in hopes of getting a sale, which obviously he/she did. There was no subtle subtext, no depth of character. This person needs to take the ProSeries at ScreenwritingU. It would be excellent for the writer and improve his/her skills.
Didn't finish watching this one.
Loved it. Too much shooting for my taste but good story line and satisfying ending.
Didn't hold my interest. 10 mins in I terminaated.
ok
